meanings.definition: The act or process of representing something in a concrete form.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used colorful drawings as instantiations to explain the complex topic.
meanings.sent2: She showed them various instantiations of the new design to choose from.
meanings.sent3: The instantiations of animals on the farm made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: His artwork served as vivid instantiations of his emotions.
meanings.sent5: The instantiations of shapes in the art class were easy to understand.

meanings.definition: An example or instance of a particular concept or idea.
meanings.sent1: The book provided clear instantiations of the scientific theory.
meanings.sent2: He shared multiple instantiations of successful marketing strategies.
meanings.sent3: The instantiations of different ice cream flavors made her hungry.
meanings.sent4: Her success story was an inspiring instantiation for many aspiring entrepreneurs.
meanings.sent5: The instantiations of kindness in the story touched everyone's hearts.
